text:
Marketing event object -
According to this post - <https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jkazarian_eventmarketing-events-HubSpot-activity-7168236150883627008-6nsE/> - we can now manually create events in HubSpot. (no need for an integration to do it).
Have you used this feature already? How do you do it? Honestly I couldn't find it anywhere in the UI.
How we can create a Custom Card in HubSpot CRM?
If you need to restore a deleted post, page, or email, please <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/get-help-with-HubSpot|reach out to Customer Support>.
I provide services to help build CRM UI extensions. What are you trying to display in the card?
I am looking to embed my capterra reviews into a HubSpot landing page. We use Sproket rocket modules. Does anyone know the best approach to complete this?
<@UATE4ATHP> should be able to help

Hi Sabrina.
Should just be able to paste in the embed code into a rich text field.

Feel free to <https://docs.sprocketrocket.co/support/submit-a-ticket|contact us> and we can help further!
do you know where you find it in capterra? I only see the option for the badge
if i want to pull a specific review
That I dont know, never used capterra
thanks!
Has anyone successfully added the HubSpot tracking code to Thinkific? We’re trying to get tracking to trigger cart abandon email and be able to use HubSpot pop-ups in Thinkific.

Customer Services receives a PO from their customer. They Add a new 'Order' in HubSpot. In the Order object they have a customer card named Purchase Order. Here they can build out the new order, with trigger button sending the order to NetSuite.
Associated contacts and companies to the order. The custom card will mainly be to quickly choose products from the product library. Build out the order to match the PO that has been sent in. Once complete, they can hit a submit button which triggers sending everything to NetSuite.
This sounds like a fun project to work on.  Are you trying to build this yourself or engage with someone who can assist?
Thanks Ryan for your reply
Actually, this is requirement from client side, and I want to build from myself
Honesly I am new in HubSpot CRM, my question is what they'r asking is it possible in this way?

In theory, what they want is possible but there are a few things you are going to want to figure out.

1.) Maybe you don't need a custom object but can get away with native "Deal" object to represent a new PO
2.) Trigger can be a button or it can be a "Deal Stage" which triggers the workflow
3.) Workflow can be a custom-coded action which makes a POST request with Deal data to your NetSuite account

Does your client use "Deals" already?
we'd want to be able to build the Order in HubSpot (not through the deal), adding line items, then when ready fire this to NetSuite. The reason why we wouldn't use the deal is simple.

#1 Often the PO the customer sends through can have more line items on it than sold by the sales person
#2  The deal might not include colours and sizes, whereas the order will need to!

If we can demo a custom card, reflecting us creating a new order (Purchase Order) by adding line items and qtys, using the product library to quickly pull through... this would be perfect to show them. They could see how we intend this to work operating from HubSpot.
I think what you want to do is possible - you'll need to read through the CRM UI documentation and example apps to get a sense of how to piece all of this together.
Can you pls share me documentation, so I can check please
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/sample-projects>
Thanks Ryan,  Are you 100% sure is it possible with this way we can achieve to sync order in netsuite?

From what I have seen with HubSpot CRM UI Extensions, I think this is accomplishable.  That being said, I don't know your experience with React framework. You said yourself you are new to HubSpot so there will be much to learn as you work your way through the documentation and build the flow you are wanting.

Please note that there are likely many details that need to be figured out.

I think one of the big unknowns for me is if "Custom UI Extensions" can be added to Custom Objects.
You'll need to spend time testing the correct configuration and validating along the way
Thanks for help
